Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the similarity in the positions of Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, and Bernie Sanders on health care by stating that they all want to put the government in charge of the individual and their doctor.
Understate: The claim understates the differences in the candidates' positions on health care by suggesting that their positions are identical.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that all three candidates want to put the government in charge of health care.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that putting the government in charge of health care is a negative thing without providing any justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the candidates' positions on health care, such as their differing views on the role of the government and the best approach to providing affordable and accessible health care.
